content: At least China and Europe recognize the disasterous path Obama is leading us down. They recognize what socialism, and redistribution of wealth schemes do to prosperity. Too bad we have a majority of wealth-envy, welfare-minded, Americans who choose to follow Obama straight into the hell he's creating for America. Obama is more than tripling our deficit with out of control socialism, and the Fed is busy printing what amounts to mononopoly money to pay for the debt. We were once the envy of the world, but the democrats have relegated us to Third World status. "The World's Finest"

content: quote: Originally posted by dmuhler: Looks like the Czech Prime Minister took a play straight from the republicans: The day after you get thrown out, you attack president Obama. quote: Czech Prime Minister Mirek Topolanek, whose country currently holds the rotating EU presidency, told the European Parliament that President Barack Obama's massive stimulus package and banking bailout "will undermine the liquidity of the global financial market." A day after his government collapsed because of a parliamentary vote of no-confidence, Topolanek took the EU presidency on a collision course with Washington over how to deal with the global economic recession. The blunt comments pushed other European politicians into damage control mode, with some reproaching the Czech leader for his language and others reaffirming their good diplomatic ties with the U.S. Translation problem. He never said that....so the mans deputy says. It's fun to watch the right wing lemmings pat themselves on the back though. <<<<//www.reuters.com/article/marketsNews/idUSLP97446520090325>>>>>

content: He said what's on the mind of a lot of people. American dollar is not just American money, it's world currency. And some poorer Euro nations use it as it's own. Inflated American dollar hurts them, especially when their currency dropping against it at the same time. The bailouts only benefit few in America, even though lots of people around the world will be affected negatively by it. It's a huge mess we are getting deeper and deeper in. I just hope we can get out of it without a major war.
reply: He said what's on the mind of a lot of people. American dollar is not just American money, it's world currency. And some poorer Euro nations use it as it's own. Inflated American dollar hurts them, especially when their currency dropping against it at the same time. The bailouts only benefit few in America, even though lots of people around the world will be affected negatively by it. It's a huge mess we are getting deeper and deeper in. I just hope we can get out of it without a major war.

content: quote: Originally posted by TataH: He said what's on the mind of a lot of people. American dollar is not just American money, it's world currency. And some poorer Euro nations use it as it's own. Inflated American dollar hurts them, especially when their currency dropping against it at the same time. The bailouts only benefit few in America, even though lots of people around the world will be affected negatively by it. It's a huge mess we are getting deeper and deeper in. I just hope we can get out of it without a major war. I disagree. Some institutions were allowed to get too big. Failure of these institutions will devastate the economy much more than deficits will. Government spending is required to make up for the lack of consumer spending. Someone has to buy these goods and services and if the consumer isn't then the government has to. Failure to do so will only lead to further job loss and less consumer spending. It will be a downward spiral.
quote: Originally posted by TataH: He said what's on the mind of a lot of people. American dollar is not just American money, it's world currency. And some poorer Euro nations use it as it's own. The bailouts only benefit few in America, even though lots of people around the world will be affected negatively by it. It's a huge mess we are getting deeper and deeper in. I just hope we can get out of it without a major war.
reply: I disagree. Some institutions were allowed to get too big. Failure of these institutions will devastate the economy much more than deficits will. Government spending is required to make up for the lack of consumer spending. Someone has to buy these goods and services and if the consumer isn't then the government has to. Failure to do so will only lead to further job loss and less consumer spending. It will be a downward spiral.
title: EU presidency: US economic plans 'a road to hell'

content: quote: Originally posted by karlhungusjr: as usual, that's 100% untrue. now before you call me a godless commie feel free to provide the numbers to back up your claim. Source: "http://www.askariali.com/page14.html" The National Debt now stands at $11,057,620,476,762.19. This averages out to $36,125.81 per person, based on a population of 306,086,421. It is increasing at a rate of $78,310.63 per second (based on the past 6 months). "The World's Finest"

content: quote: Originally posted by dmuhler: Looks like the Czech Prime Minister took a play straight from the republicans: The day after you get thrown out, you attack president Obama. quote: Czech Prime Minister Mirek Topolanek, whose country currently holds the rotating EU presidency, told the European Parliament that President Barack Obama's massive stimulus package and banking bailout "will undermine the liquidity of the global financial market." A day after his government collapsed because of a parliamentary vote of no-confidence, Topolanek took the EU presidency on a collision course with Washington over how to deal with the global economic recession. The blunt comments pushed other European politicians into damage control mode, with some reproaching the Czech leader for his language and others reaffirming their good diplomatic ties with the U.S. Translation problem. He never said that....so the mans deputy says. It's fun to watch the right wing lemmings pat themselves on the back though. <<<<//www.reuters.com/article/marketsNews/idUSLP97446520090325>>>>>

content: He said what's on the mind of a lot of people. American dollar is not just American money, it's world currency. And some poorer Euro nations use it as it's own. Inflated American dollar hurts them, especially when their currency dropping against it at the same time. The bailouts only benefit few in America, even though lots of people around the world will be affected negatively by it. It's a huge mess we are getting deeper and deeper in. I just hope we can get out of it without a major war.
reply: He said what's on the mind of a lot of people. American dollar is not just American money, it's world currency. And some poorer Euro nations use it as it's own. content: quote: Originally posted by TataH: He said what's on the mind of a lot of people. American dollar is not just American money, it's world currency. And some poorer Euro nations use it as it's own. Inflated American dollar hurts them, especially when their currency dropping against it at the same time. The bailouts only benefit few in America, even though lots of people around the world will be affected negatively by it. It's a huge mess we are getting deeper and deeper in. I just hope we can get out of it without a major war. I disagree. Some institutions were allowed to get too big. Failure of these institutions will devastate the economy much more than deficits will. Government spending is required to make up for the lack of consumer spending. Someone has to buy these goods and services and if the consumer isn't then the government has to. Failure to do so will only lead to further job loss and less consumer spending. It will be a downward spiral.

reply: I disagree. Some institutions were allowed to get too big. Failure of these institutions will devastate the economy much more than deficits will. Government spending is required to make up for the lack of consumer spending. Someone has to buy these goods and services and if the consumer isn't then the government has to. Failure to do so will only lead to further job loss and less consumer spending. It will be a downward spiral.
title: EU presidency: US economic plans 'a road to hell'

Now that is as good as it gets. Socialist Europe and Communist China warning us about the evils of socialism. This has got to be one of your all time greatest hits! Kegler at his best!

title: EU presidency: US economic plans 'a road to hell'

content: quote: Originally posted by karlhungusjr: as usual, that's 100% untrue. now before you call me a godless commie feel free to provide the numbers to back up your claim. Source: "http://www.askariali.com/page14.html" The National Debt now stands at $11,057,620,476,762.19. This averages out to $36,125.81 per person, based on a population of 306,086,421. It is increasing at a rate of $78,310.63 per second (based on the past 6 months). "The World's Finest"
